definition: A person who resides or is living in a particular place, often used to refer to someone who is a resident or occupant of a specific institution or facility.

examples.german: Der Insasse des Gef√§ngnisses wurde entlassen.
examples.english: The inmate of the prison was released.

examples.german: Der Insasse des Fahrzeugs wurde bei dem Unfall verletzt.
examples.english: The occupant of the vehicle was injured in the accident.

examples.german: Der Insasse des Hauses rief die Polizei an.
examples.english: The resident of the house called the police.

examples.german: Der Insasse des Zuges verpasste seine Haltestelle.
examples.english: The passenger on the train missed his stop.

examples.german: Der Insasse des Flugzeugs hatte Flugangst.
examples.english: The passenger on the plane had a fear of flying.
